Constructor Detail

GOState

public GOState(GOState.StateType stateType,
               int defaultTransitionIndex,
               int duration)
Creates a new State.

Parameters:
stateType - has to be one of the provided stateIDs, e.g. GOState.StateID.IDLE
duration - specifies the duration of this very state.
Method Detail

start

public void start(int startOffsetTime)
Starts a State.

Parameters:
startOffsetTime - Sets the currentTime to the desired offset. Normally you can just pass 0 as argument to start the state at its beginning.

update

public void update(int dt)
updates a State.

Parameters:
dt - increments the state's currentTime by dt.

getPercentage

public float getPercentage()
Calculates the percentage the transition between states

Returns:
a float between 0 and 1 ... except the state is overdue, then it could be more.

hasExpiredSince

public int hasExpiredSince()
Determines whether a state has expired

Returns:
either a negative number: meaning the state has not expired, but will in n milliseconds or a positive number: which tells you for how many milliseconds the state has expired.

getCurrentTime

public int getCurrentTime()

public int getDuration()

getStateType

public GOState.StateType getStateType()
Returns the StateID.

Returns:
The stateID

getDefaultTransitionIndex

public int getDefaultTransitionIndex()
returns the default transition index

Returns:
the default transition index

getCounter

public int getCounter()
Returns how many times the state was active. This will help implementing everything that repeatedly uses the same state, because each state now can tell for how long it was running.

Returns:
times the state was active
